result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A Pridgeon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A Pridgeon

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:49 PM. Baltz has received a copy of ROAW, no inaccuracies. State believes he has 186 days credit. Baltz will stipulate to that amount. State is asking for 9 months in FC jail on both counts, 6 and 7, concurrent to each other. Baltz makes statement and asks for a time served disposition. Pridgeon makes statement, remorseful. Court - has reviewed summary and sentences to counts 6 & 7 - 186 days in FC jail, gives credit for 186 days (time served), concurrent to each other. Appeal rights given. Civil judgment for any unpaid costs.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 26, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
per JA Bradley.. Defendant has plea hearing date of Jan 12, 2018 in Milwaukee County.  Will not be able to transfer to Forest County until after that date..pb

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:50 PM. State - recites resolution, Count 2 amended to 450.11(7)(h) unclassified misd. - free to argue jail time, state will be asking for 6 months and costs. Count 6 amended to 946.41 obstructing an officer. Count 7 would be amended to misd. bail jumping, counts 6 & 7 - 2 year probation sentence, costs on each count, standard conditions. Remaining counts DRI. Torphy and Pridgeon agree. Court DRI counts, 1, 3, 4 & 5. Court amends Count 2 to 450.11(7)(h) unclaissified misd. Defendant pleads G to amended charge. Court amends count 6 to 946.41 obstructing and officer. Defendant pleads G to amended charge. Court amends count 7 to misd. BJ. Defendant pleads G to amended charge. Court has PLQ and goes over form with DE, finds he is freely, voluntairly and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement and asks 6 months with good time (32 days credit) State referes to 15CF95 where case was dismissed and re-filed and that is where the credit comes from in that case. Torphy makes final statement and asks the court to consider a time served sentence on Count 2. Pridgeon makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences Pridgeon to the following: Counts 6 & 7 court with holds sentence and places on probation for 2 years with condtions: AODA and follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, 100 Hours of Community service, take all medication as prescribed by doctor, costs on each count, FT emp/schooling. Count 2 - Court sentences the DE to 4 months in the FC jail with huber and good time, 32 days credit, costs to be entered as a civil judgment. Appeal rights given, must submit DNA with expungement verbage. Torphy indicates there is money that was seized at time of arrest and State will follow up with FOSO to get the money returned to the defendant. Money to be returned to attorney's trust accout and attorney will be responsible to get money to the defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Michael F Torphy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:47 AM. State - this matter is set for 3:30 this afternoon, defendant is not here as he is currently incarcerated in Milwaukee County. Torphy - makes statement in regards to status of case, believes the defendant will be revoked from the State of Arkansas for stated reasons, states that the defendant has indicated to him that he no longer wants his representation and he has no objection to the dismissal of his representation. State has no objections to his withdrawal. Court not granting the withdrawal at this point until it receives information from the defendant. Court issues bench warrant, body or $10,000.00 until it receives a stipulation from the defendant in regards to representation. Torphy - was not sure if the defendant was going to be transported to Forest County for this afternoon's hearing. Torphy will work on the stipulation. Court also forfeits any bond posted subject to any objections to it being forfeited. Torphy asks the Court to stay the warrant to be stayed until 3:30 as well as the forfeiture of the bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Michael F Torphy in court who appears telephonically with leave of the court. Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon does not appear.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:51 AM. State - been informed off the record that the defendant is currently incarcerated in Milwaukee County. Torphy agrees, believes he is on a P&P hold with Arkansas Parole. Court asks defense counsel if the matter was resolved or if it needs to be set for JT. Torphy responds, plea offer was made, believes the defendant will be accepting the plea offer but would like a little time before setting for PLEAS. State asks for warrant for arrest for stated reasons along with a PLEAS date. Torphy - objects to the warrant for stated reasons. Court issues bench warrant, body only, and if/when the release is received - let Court know and it may quash the warrant. Torphy responds. Sets for PLEAS on assumption that he is going to accept the plea. Torphy believes he will be taking the plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon, in custody, in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:12 PM. State - discussions off record indicating that offer had not been offered until today and Torphy would like some time to go over the offer. Torphy agrees. Court will set for another FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with Charish Douyette and no consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:17 AM. State calls Detective Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 9:18 AM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (9:25 AM). Cross exam by Torphy at 9:32 AM. Torphy offers exhibit #1 - letter from CD. Torphy offers exhibit #2 - officer's report. State objects - relevance - overruled (9:42 AM). Torphy offers exhibit #3 - officer's report regarding stop. State objects - speculation - sustained (9:47 AM). Robinson excused at 9:49 AM. Torphy calls Charish Douyette. Douyette sworn in at 9:4 AM. Direct exam by Torphy. State objects - relevance - sustained (9:51 AM). State objects - relevance - overruled (9:51 AM). Cross exam by State at 9:55 AM. Douyette excused at 9:56 AM. State makes argument for the finding of probable cause. Torphy responds and makes argument for the Court not to find probable cause and requests dismissal of case. State responds with further argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Torphy has Information, reviews, waives further reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas and sets for FPT. Torphy makes argument for bond - asks for reduction in bond. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - court reduces bond to $1,000 cash that is already posted. State requests a no contact provision of no contact with Charish Douyette. Torphy - no objections. Court - no contact with Charish Douyette and no consumption of alcohol.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon A Pridgeon
Current: 120 East National, Apt. #326, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 02-22-2016)
Prior: 8700 W Congress St. #3, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant Brandon A Pridgeon appears via video from FOSO with attorney Michael F Torphy appearing in court.  Mike Rielly also appears as was previously appointed by SPD to case. Family has now hired attorney Torphy. Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:40 PM Torphy has just received a large amount of discovery from Attorney Rielly and would like to address bond. Court relieves Attorney Rilley from case. Court reads charges and penalties. Pridgeon understands charges. Torphy waives further reading will waive time limits for PH. Torphy asks for $1000 cash bond which was moved from case 15CF95 to this case on 12/15/15. State asks for $5000 cash bond. Court - sets $5000 cash bond for reasons as stated on the record, can address further at ARGN. Torphy asks to now adhere to time limits. Off record for scheduling, 2:57 PM. Recalled on the record, 3:00 PM.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
from attorney requesting updating court on defendant

Attorney Michael F Torphy appears telephonically.  Defendant Brandon A Pridgeion does not appear. Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:57 PM. Torphy - understands the defendant is not here and did not appear previously, states he has been retained on this case and previously filed case, states the defendant has a case also in Milwaukee County and is being held there on our hold. Torphy would like Court to set a date. Court sets this matter for proceedings - has no objection to the attorney appearing telephonically if no objection to the signature bond. Court continues warrant at this point and does not set bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Michael G. Levine appears by telephone. No other appearances.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:44 PM. State - off record discussion put on the record, regarding attorney asking to withdraw from case. Levine asks to be withdrawn from case. Court grants request for attorney Levine to withdraw. Levine will send order. Court - warrant will continue.
